importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The AWS outage occurred on Monday, October 20, 2025, marking a significant disruption in global digital infrastructure, highlighting the critical role of cloud services in daily life.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The outage began at 07:11 GMT and lasted for approximately three hours, during which critical services across the internet failed due to a DNS-related error in AWS's DynamoDB service.

keyTakeAways: An error in a technical update to DynamoDB's API caused a cascade failure in AWS's infrastructure, affecting 113 services.
The root cause was a DNS issue that prevented apps from locating DynamoDB's server addresses, leading to widespread outages.

The outage impacted major services including Snapchat, Pinterest, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Starbucks, banks, financial apps like Venmo, and media outlets such as The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal.
Cloud outages are common but increasingly impactful due to the deep integration of cloud services into everyday digital operations.
Experts, including Joshua Mahony and Bryson Bort, suggest that such outages are typically due to human error, not cyberattacks or malicious activity.
AWS responded quickly, restoring services and stated that all core systems were fixed by 10:11 GMT, though some users experienced message processing delays.

summaryOfNewsArticle: An outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) on October 20, 2025, began at 07:11 GMT and lasted until 10:11 GMT due to a technical error in a DynamoDB API update that triggered a DNS failure. This caused a cascade failure affecting 113 AWS services, including major apps such as Snapchat, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Starbucks, banks, financial services, media outlets, and smart home devices like Ring and Alexa. Experts attribute the failure to human error rather than a cyberattack, and AWS confirmed it had fully resolved the issue, though some users faced delays in message processing. The incident underscores the critical dependence of modern digital life—ranging from finance and communication to entertainment and smart devices—on centralized cloud infrastructure, with AWS remaining the dominant provider despite the risks of systemic failure.
title: What caused Amazon’s AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
